alert.note: Alert for Casey; Marion; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:26PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion, east central Taylor and northern Casey Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 326 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Campbellsville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Marion, east central Taylor and northern Casey Counties, including the following locations... Peytons Store, Bass, Mannsville, Atterson, Feathersburg, Ellisburg, Chilton, Middleburg, Jacktown and Butchertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central and central Kentucky.
